intro: Galium bungei var. miltorrhizum, commonly known as Chinese bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
